content:
surfaceGrp

surfaceGrpsurface group defines any kind of useful grouping of written surfaces, for example the recto and verso of a single leaf, which the encoder wishes to treat as a single unit. [11.1 Digital Facsimiles ]
Moduletranscr â€” Transcription of primary sources

    • surfaceGrp
    Note

    Where it is useful or meaningful to do so, any grouping of multiple surface elements may be indicated using the surfaceGrp elements.

    Example
    <sourceDoc> <surfaceGrp> <surface ulx="0" uly="0" lrx="200" lry="300"> <graphic url="Bovelles-49r.png"/> </surface> <surface ulx="0" uly="0" lrx="200" lry="300"> <graphic url="Bovelles-49v.png"/> </surface> </surfaceGrp> </sourceDoc>
    Content model<content> <alternate minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <classRef key="model.global"/> <elementRef key="surface"/> <elementRef key="surfaceGrp"/> </alternate> </content>
